content:
I'm glad you're considering incorporating strength training exercises to improve your cycling performance. As you mentioned, targeting your core, legs, and glutes will help increase your power, endurance, and efficiency on the bike. I provided some exercises and routines that can benefit your cycling performance, including planks, squats, lunges, calf raises, glute bridges, and deadlifts. Remember to start with lighter weights and gradually increase the intensity as you build strength. It's also essential to listen to your body and rest when needed to avoid injury.

Now, let's talk about your cycling training. How many weeks do you have left until your 40km cycling event on June 1st? Are you planning to increase your training intensity or volume in the coming weeks?
